text: "When Connecticut did licensing, their shootings dropped, their murders dropped 40%. Suicides dropped 15%."
"Nowadays, there is more regulation over toy guns than real ones."
"We now have longitudinal data that shows that children born around Superfund sites have dramatically higher rates of birth defects, dramatically higher rates of autism."
Says President Donald Trump "cut funding from the Justice Department to investigate these domestic terrorist groups, these white supremacist groups."
"Farmer suicide rates are as high as they have been since the Great Depression."
"Even the (Congressional Budget Office) says if you lower Medicare to allow 50 year olds to get into it, you can not only save the government money, but you can lower premiums for all Americans."
"Research shows that 1 percent of licensed dealers supply a whopping 57 percent of the guns that are recovered in crimes."
"In American history since 9/11, we've had 85 major attacks in our country, 73 percent of them have been by white nationalist hate groups."
"In 2009, Mitch McConnell was the person that’s saying, 'Hey, we should get all the ethics information in before we do the hearings.' "
The war on drugs led to "a 500 percent increase in incarceration in our country, disproportionately affecting poor and disproportionately affecting minorities."
"Al-Qaida operatives, have said, 'Hey, we want you to use this loophole (for purchasing guns despite being on a watch list) to attack and kill Americans.'"
"You’re more likely to get struck by lightning in Texas" than find in-person voter fraud.
"We built a new prison every 10 days between 1990 and 2005 to keep up with our mass incarceration explosion of nonviolent offenders."
Newark is "now home to one-third of all commercial and multi-family development."
Says 2012 was the "first year in American history that more minorities are being born than people in the majority."
Says "right now, we have more military spending than the next 10, 11, 12 countries combined."
"You see 34 people (are) murdered every single day" by gunfire in America.

Says the Republican Party platform says "pull back even more of the rules on campaign finance reform, get rid of McCain-Feingold" while the Democratic Party platform says "we want to find a way to put more fair rules on campaign finance reform."

"The first (state) budget that came out of our Republican leadership slashed funding to Planned Parenthood...It resulted in the reduction of hours, the elimination of days, elimination of access to women in my city and all over my state."
Says under President Barack Obama there’s been "the lowest discretionary spending we’ve had in decades in the United States."
Says New Jersey’s prison system is "61 percent African-American even though our state is just 13 percent black."
Says New Jersey Devils managing partner Jeff Vanderbeek "took us into arbitration."

Says New Jersey Devils managing partner Jeff Vanderbeek "froze all those monies during the toughest years in ‘08-’09" and "refused to give the charitable dollars that he was required to give by the contract."
"We've seen in this last year tremendous things happening, including our unemployment rate come down 2 percentage points."
Says America spends "over 17 percent of its GDP on health care costs when our closest competitor nations are spending about 12."
Says "if you are shot in the city of Newark, you have over an 80 percent chance that you've been arrested before an average of 10 times."
Says more than eight countries lead the United States in the percentage of college graduates.
Says for the first time in the history of the United States, the government cut taxes during wartime
The ACLU didn't call for an investigation (of the Newark police department), they called for an immediate federal monitor.
